subject: Fashion
title: Dior's New Look
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dior's New Look.

hook.text: In 1947, women had been wearing boxy wartime clothes for years. Christian Dior dropped a bomb.

buildup.text: His debut collection used 20 yards of fabric per dressâ€”a shocking amount after years of rationing.

discovery.text: The 'New Look' cinched waists, padded hips, and swept skirts to mid-calf. Curves were back.

twist.text: Protesters ripped New Look dresses off women in the street, calling it a betrayal of wartime spirit.

climax.text: Dior won. Within two years, every woman wanted that silhouette. Wartime austerity was finished.

punchline.text: One collection rewrote how the world got dressed.

quiz.question: Why was Dior's 'New Look' controversial when it debuted?
options: It used tiny amounts of fabric, which offended luxury buyers
It used extravagant amounts of fabric after years of wartime rationing
It was copied directly from wartime utility designs
